Welcome to Your Dashboard

Team members: Jayson Urena, Diya Ram Mohan, Houda Lahrouz, Montel Marks | Faculty advisor: Thomas Gyeera | Sponsor: Bank of America | Mentor: Shailesh Deshpande

Bank of America is looking to create a shared services layer to centralize and standardize the way data is served to the business. In the first phase of this project, the foundation was established with a dashboard integrated with SQL databases, using tools such as Hasura, Denodo, GraphQL, and Python. The second phase aims to expand functionality, introduce additional tools, and enhance security measures within the application.

Key Issues Addressed:this will be updated as we go on the project

Data Visualization: A significant challenge was the lack of visualization capabilities, limiting how employees interact with data. To address this, we set up Tableau using a free trial to ensure cost efficiency. We established a seamless connection to Tableau via cDataâ€™s GraphQL connector, enabling rich, interactive data visualizations.

Quality Control: Data quality issues, particularly those leading to costly data leaks, were a major concern. Our team implemented rigorous quality control mechanisms to prevent inconsistencies and ensure data integrity.

Access Control: Security and privacy were paramount. We set up a new Auth0 project and successfully linked it with Hasura, ensuring secure and managed access to critical data.

Additionally, we completed the hosting of data in Neon and deployed it on DDN, enhancing scalability and reliability. These improvements contribute to a more secure, efficient, and data-driven decision-making process.
